title: Zimbabwe: Pressure Group Says Many People Will Die As Result of Supreme Court Labour Ruling
text:
South Africa: Hanekom v Gigaba - When a Law Hurts the Country 
Activists, on the other hand, are contemplating staging protests against the judgment. 
A statement from the Itai Rusike-led CWGH said the country's death rate is going to increase as a result of blood pressure and stress caused to workers by the shocking judgment. 
"Among those that have been offloaded are people with chronic illnesses such as cancer, diabetes, hypertension (HBP) and HIV, and they stand to automatically lose their medical aid cover as they are rendered incapable of paying for monthly subscriptions," said Rusike. 
"Laid-off workers on anti-retroviral therapy (ART) may not be able to access the quality health services they used to enjoy, a development that may result in serious health complications or even death." 
Rusike added: "Abrupt loss of income may also compromise adherence to medication for workers and dependants on chronic care, including those on ART as they may be forced to relocate to their rural homes where their changed circumstances may limit their travel to places where they used to get their allocations." 
"It should be emphasised that adherence to ART is essential for maximising individual treatment outcomes, minimising complications, and preventing the development of drug resistance." Zimbabwe
